alert.note: Alert for Bates; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 3:31PM CDT until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...Kansas... Spring River near Waco affecting Jasper County. Spring River at Carthage affecting Jasper County. Spring River above Baxter Springs affecting Cherokee County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Missouri... Shoal Creek near Joplin affecting Newton and Jasper Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. Sac River near Caplinger Mills affecting Cedar County. Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Horton...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Marmaton River Basin...including Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sac River Basin...including Caplinger Mills...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Spring River Basin...including Baxter Springs, Waco, Carthage...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Osage River near Schell City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, flood waters impact all of the low lying areas in the Schell Osage Conservation Area as well as several county roads west of Schell City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 32.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM CDT Saturday was 32.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 32.5 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.5 feet on 09/18/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM CDT.
